text:
What is the R function that can read Arrow.jl's Arrow.write()? I just tried feather::read_feather() but it said
```Error in openFeather(path) : Invalid: Not a feather file
Calls: read_feather -> feather -> openFeather```

elements.text: What is the R function that can read Arrow.jl's Arrow.write()? I just tried feather::read_feather() but it said

Error in openFeather(path) : Invalid: Not a feather file
Calls: read_feather -> feather -> openFeather

text: I'd try with the arrow R package.

elements.text: I'd try with the arrow R package.

text:
Check the version of the R package.  The most recent version of the arrow package is 3.0.0

Unfortunately both the R package and the Python `pyarrow` package refer to the on-disk arrow format as `feather` even though it is not compatible with the original feather format.

text: In what I can only describe as "peak R", if you are on a Linux system you must set the environment variable `NOT_CRAN=true` before installing the arrow package if you want it to have a full installation including compression.  See <https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/#installation>

text: Also, as I found by unfortunate experience, you must have `-c conda-forge` in the call to `conda install` if you install Python's `pyarrow` package via conda.
